pages.text: Redstone works the same as in vanilla, however obtaining it is a little different, requiring some different components. Redstone dust itself is made in a quern by crushing Cinnabar or Cryolite.$(br2)The first component we need is the rod. Rods can be made from Gold, Wrought Iron, or Steel by working an ingot in the anvil. 1 ingot = 2 rods.

pages.title: Powered Rail
pages.text: The vanilla Powered Rail is the only use for Gold Rods.

pages.title: Activator Rail
pages.text: Rails are one use for Wrought Iron Rods. Steel is also used for these recipes, with double output.

pages.title: Activator Rail
pages.text: These recipes are a little more productive than in Vanilla, to make up for their cost.
Working a single brass ingot (9 parts Copper to 1 parts Zinc/Sphalerite) in an anvil can produce 2 brass mechanisms, which are needed to craft some redstone blocks.

pages.title: Sticky Piston
pages.text: Sealing bonemeal in Limewater (Water + Flux) will produce Glue, a substitute for a slimeball.
